Visited the Energy Fuels processing facility in White Mesa, Utah, which is the only conventional uranium mill operating in the U.S. today. Joined Congressmen @BurgessOwens and @RepMikeKennedy to see firsthand how this site is supporting American energy security and national defense.

This facility doesn’t just produce uranium: it’s the only producer of dysprosium oxide in the Western Hemisphere, a rare earth element for advanced military and energy technologies. It’s also a model for what responsible critical mineral development can look like.

With the right strategy, we can expand these efforts in places like #CO03—boosting our national security, creating jobs, and protecting the environment.

On this Constitution Day, it’s worth remembering what Alexander Hamilton said in the Federalist Papers: “The vigor of government is essential to the security of liberty,” and “a dangerous ambition more often lurks behind the specious mask of zeal for the rights of the people than under the forbidden appearance of zeal for the firmness and efficiency of government.”

It’s a reminder that those who shout the loudest about “the rights of the people” aren’t always the ones most committed to protecting them. The Founders understood that liberty and good government go hand in hand, that noise isn’t principle, and that ambition dressed up in slogans is still ambition. Real liberty depends on order, accountability, and the quiet work of principled self-government. #ConstitutionDay #CO03
